TEXT.TITLE: ITALIAN TREASURY DETAILS NEW BILL OFFER
TEXT.BODY: The Italian treasury said it would offer 3,500 billion lire of short-term treasury bills (BOTs) at rates slightly lower than the preceding offer in mid-February. It said it would offer 1,500 billion lire of six-month paper priced at 95.35 pct for a net annualised compound yield of 9.30 pct. Net yield on the preceding issue was 9.46 pct. The treasury said it would also offer 2,000 billion lire of 12-month bills at a base price of 91.15 pct for a net annual yield of 9.05 pct, down from 9.22 pct in mid-February. The bills replace maturing paper worth 3,196 billion lire and subscriptions to the offer close March 10. REUTER
